title: How to Make Mandarin Muffins

steps.headline: Beat the eggs slightly with a fork.
Pour in the milk or orange juice and melted butter or coconut oil.
Sift in the flour and baking powder.
steps.description: Add the sugar and salt. Mix quickly.

steps.headline: Place a mandarin segment in the bottom of each muffin hole.
Pour the batter over the top.
steps.description: Aim for an even amount of batter in each hole.

steps.headline: Place the muffin pan into the preheated oven.
Bake for 20 minutes.
steps.description: The muffins are done when a skewer inserted into the muffin returns clean.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Allow to cool on a wire cooling rack.

text: Preparing the Batter Beat the eggs slightly with a fork.  Pour in the milk or orange juice and melted butter or coconut oil. Stir quickly. Sift in the flour and baking powder. Add the sugar and salt. Mix quickly. Pouring the Batter Grease the muffin pan. Preheat the oven to 400ºF/200ºC. Place a mandarin segment in the bottom of each muffin hole.  Pour the batter over the top. Aim for an even amount of batter in each hole. Baking the Muffins Place the muffin pan into the preheated oven.  Bake for 20 minutes. The muffins are done when a skewer inserted into the muffin returns clean. Remove from the oven. Allow to cool on a wire cooling rack.
